results.title: You'll soon get the hang of it
results.brief_description: Aims to impart the basic psychology of training and motivation and how to apply it when passing on knowledge and skills to a trainee. John Cleese uses a variety of situations - manual, clerical and technical - to put over the essential points and illustrate the major pitfalls.

results.title: You'll love New Orleans and she'll love you right back
results.creator_credit: Carolyn Ramsey Productions and Carolyn Ramsey
results.brief_description: Shows many aspects of New Orleans - the French style buildings, the Spanish style gardens. Looks at the sports and cultural activities, including jazz bands. Script, Carolyn Ramsey; photographer, Bill Delgado; commentator, John Pela.

results.title: You'll get yours when you're 65
results.brief_description: A look at Social Security, how it works and its effect on the nation’s aged. Questions raised include how social or how secure one can be on today’s pensions and some administration plans for the future are discussed.

results.title: You'll Be Back
results.brief_description:
Looks at the problems of readjustment that prisoners face on their release from gaol. The dramatisation of particular situations illustrates the type of troubles that may occur and representatives from various organisations, such as Legal Aid, Odyssey House and Personal Emergency Services, advise on how to avoid trouble.

Featuring Gary Sweet as the protagonist, and music by Rose Tattoo.

results.title: You'd have to be mad to like opera
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Karl McPhee and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian Opera”.
Explores the personality of opera singer Isobel Buchanan, and gives an insight into her life as an opera singer. She is seen in a number of situations which show the wide range of activities and disciplines which go towards the making of an opera. Particular emphasis is placed on rehearsal and actual performance of the opera ‘Don Pasquale’. Production manager, Roy Bissell; director, script, Karl McPhee; editor, Ian Walker; sound, Rodney Simmons; photographer, Andrew Fraser.

results.title: Yothu Yindi, diti murru: the videos (A)
results.creator_credit: Burrundi Pictures, Axolotol, John Wilkinson, Stephen M Johnson, Martin Stauce and Alan James
results.brief_description: Mandawuy Yunupingu and Witiyana Marika from Yothu Yindi introduce these videos from their album “Tribal voice”. The brief introductions and the videos themselves give a simple, but telling overview of Aboriginal culture and the need for black and white society to find a common meeting place. The videos are: “Treaty”, “Mainstream”, a traditional Aboriginal dance Gudurrku = brolga”, “Treaty: Filthy Lucre mix”, “Djapana: Gapirri mix and “Tribal voice”, which encompasses a plea for all indigenous cultures to be recognised.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Burrundi Pictures, Axolotol, John Wilkinson, Stephen M Johnson, Martin Stauce and Alan James

results.title: Yoshiko the Papermaker (Japan)
results.creator_credit: Deepa Mehta, Paul Saltzman and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Yoshiko Fujimoto, thirteen, lives in the tiny mountain village of Obara-Mura which retains its seven hundred year old traditions for unique handmade paper panels. Yoshiko learns this ancient art from a local master.

results.title: Yoshi no yama: a classical Japanese dance
results.brief_description: A single dancer, by the use of masks, tells the story of three friends of different temperaments. A preface shows the application of kabuki make-up; the dance itself, a buyo dance with the stylization and refinement of the no tradition, is performed with the choreographic use of the on-stage-hand, or figure in black.
results.title_for_label: Yoshi no yama: a classical Japanese dance

results.title: Yoru no omnatachi = Women of the night
results.creator_credit: Mitsushio Shimizu, Shochiku and Kenji Mizoguchi
results.brief_description:
Women of the night’ details how two sisters are driven to prostitution by poverty. The narrative blocks out this nether world life with a well developed story which gives a moving portrayal of their lives, fraught with attempts at escape. In the film’s climax the two women are accused of being traitors to their class by the judge and jury who are fellow whores. A feminist tract, ‘Women of the night’ is a moving drama plotting the destroyed lives of two women.

Credits: Producer, Mitsushio Shimizu ; director, Kenji Mizoguchi ; writer, Yoshitaka Yoda ; photography, Shigeto Miki ; music, Hisato Osawa ; editing, Tazuko Sakane.
Cast: Kinuyo Tanaka, Sanae Takasugi, Mitsuo Nagata, Tomie Tsunoda, Kumeko Urabe, Minpei Tomimoto.

results.title: Yorta Yorta: the river people of the Murray 'Tongola'
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and George Nelson
results.brief_description: Yorta Yorta descendant, George Nelson, talks about his great grandfather, Thomas James or as he was more fondly known as, grandpa james. An interesting history of Echuca, missionary life and Aboriginal culture and identity.
